speaker: User
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_2 : Hi there, I would like to in-text cite a fictional character from a novel, as I'm taking a direct quote of theirs, how do I state it?

speaker: User
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_2 : would the in-text citation be the authors full name? or just the last name?

speaker: User
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_2 : Alright, Thank you then! That is all from me

speaker: User
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_2 : Hope u have a good day~

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 PERSON_LASTNAME_1 : Hello, how may I help you?

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 PERSON_LASTNAME_1 : I believe in this case you should cite the author of the novel.

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 PERSON_LASTNAME_1 : but to make it clear that it's from a character, maybe you can put it like this (just as an example):

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 PERSON_LASTNAME_1 : in the novel "THe Big Four", Hercule PERSON_LASTNAME_2 often said, "Order and method, and the little grey cells" (Christie, 1927)

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 PERSON_LASTNAME_1 : the year being the year when the novel is published

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 PERSON_LASTNAME_1 : just as an example :)

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 PERSON_LASTNAME_1 : if you can pinpoint the page number, you can include that in the in-text citation as well

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 PERSON_LASTNAME_1 : Is there anything else I can assist?

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 PERSON_LASTNAME_1 : just the last name, as per the usual rule :)

speaker: Help Desk
message: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1 PERSON_LASTNAME_1 : good luck for your assignment!
